Justin Drew wonders how things will be like on his day job teaching. It becomes bothersome to know whether or not problems will arise from this whole experience. Then again, things like this are usual if anything. Being a health teacher, all he has to do is show the students the benefits of keeping their body in good condition as well as making the right choices in preventing any problems later on in the student's life. He cares about the well-being of those he teaches as well as those he hopes will become inspiring and kind people.

Who cares whether the stories revolving around the disappearances of the male students and teachers. All of it could be fake news. The academy even welcomes him to teach the students at the academy with open arms, and it is a great chance to make sure he gets things right this time.

It will be a piece of cake. Even though this academy is far away, it's not going to be much of a hassle when he can drive there.
He is ready to do this; willing to be helpful however he can. Packing up his papers, USB disks, and other necessities, Justin becomes eager in seeing how things will go. Getting into his car, Justin Drew heads off to the academy. It is going to be a long ride to get there.

Time passes by and he arrives at his destination. Surely enough...

11311.content:
It all started with the directions he was told to follow his GPS giving him strange directions on roads he has only seen and had no need to travel on. then he came to part of his destination a long tunnel going through a mountain but what was odd was the parking lot a spot mark with his name waiting for him and no building or anything. "They can't expect teachers to carry all their stuff through the tunnel and class do they?" Justin asks as he parks his car but as he steps out a voice calls out to him. "Mr. Drew welcome."

Justin spins to see a women he knew was not there a second ago began to walk up to him she was oddly pale for what looked like a healthy and some what muscular build. she had long black hair and light blue eyes and wore a simple long sleeve button down shirt but she seemed to refuse to button up all the way as she shows off a more then healthy amount of cleavage and a knee length skirt that seemed tighter then she probably liked. "Mr. Drew welcome to MGA I'm so happy to see you I'm Ms. Fuyu." She gave a small bow Which Justin returned.

"Um thanks I'm guessing your the Dean of the school?" He asked he had only talked to her by E-mail and those he talked to on phone where other figures in the school. Ms. Fuyu only shook her head. "No sorry Ms. Rose is too busy but I'm her assistant and she asked me to help you out." she gave a nice smile that seemed to warm Justin's heart a little. "So I guess the school is-" "A short walk don't worry to much Mr. Drew just down that tunnel." Justin sighs as he was interrupted and his small worry about a long walk was proven he began to open up his trunk when a hand shuts it. "Don't worry about unpacking yet your still a day ahead of schedule so don't worry in fact I was sent to escort you to the welcoming party."

He looked confused but shrugged it off as Ms. Fuyu placed a cold hand on his shoulder he nearly jumped at the feeling but she didn't react to it. the two traveled down the tunnel which seemed to absorb light silence seemed never ending as no sound came form ether end not even the sound of wind traveled down here Justin seemed to get nervous as he traveled further in as the feeling he was being watched but he was unsure by what it seemed more strange than the women traveling besides him the feeling was something older stranger it didn't seem threatening but it was odd.

at one point Justin lost track of when the two had reached the end of the tunnel and found something that should not be there a large school building sitting next to a small forest of trees that all seemed healthy if not a bit overgrown, and on the other side was a large beach entering into what looked like a ocean. Justin was surprised by the beauty but also scared knowing this didn't make sense mostly because he was in the middle of freaking Texas there was no beach or forest for miles how could any of this be here. he tried to turn around but only saw nothing the tunnel, his old beat up car, the nearly empty parking lot all was gone instead behind him was open air and the boxes he had packed in the back with a odd sheet of paper taped to the top. he tried to get his stuff when a familair cold hand was placed on his shoulder turning he sees Ms. Fuyu different as her hand now bares longer nails and her skin was a pure white her clothes didn't change but a cold aura seems to surround her. 1141.content:
--------------------------------------
Present Day
Location: Bus #4 to MGA
Weather: Mostly Sunny
Time: 9:37 AM
--------------------------------------

You are currently on the front row seats to one of these MGA schools, along with a handful of other students who will also be attending the same school you're going. You remember the letter states that every year, each MGA sends out exactly 100 invitations to male students who are considered qualified in there eyes for whatever reason.

"Hey, you're one of those students that the academy wants, right?" The bus man said.

"Yeah, decided to switch schools since the one I was at wasn't working out." You replied.

"In that case, you better watch yourself. Despite being a so-called 'girl only private school' those ladies are becoming impatience for a playmate." The man spoke.

You were confuse by what he meant until the bus drove through a weird tunnel. The bus begins to speed up until a blinding light appear, causing everyone to cover their eyes.

"Here we are everyone. The Island of Eden." The bus driver spoke.

You lower your arms and notice the bus has stopped. Everyone looked out the window and saw the bus was next a beach area with a good view of the ocean, a huge forest area with overgrown trees, and a couple of mountains on opposite sides of the island. Everyone but the bus driver walked out and started to head for the first building in sight. You were the last one out as you couldn't believe a bus made it's destination without the help of a boat or a bridge... In fact, the tunnel was nowhere to be seen. Just the pavement alone.

"You boys need to go through the entrance building first, before you can go to the academy. Be careful. This can be a dangerous place. Mainly for humans." The driver said. "Here's some advice, if you want to survive til the end... You need to keep those lovely ladies from having their way with you."

"H-Huh? Wait, are you saying that we need to keep them... out of... our... pants?" The bus drove away before you could finish speaking.

After the bus left for god knows where. You turned to the first building and caught up with everyone else. Your current objective is to head for the entrance building and learn the whereabouts of the academy.

What happen next?
1141.title: Into the Unknown

115.content:
It was another day here. "Another absolutely, normal school day." You told yourself. A week ago you were suddenly transported to another world, and by a week ago, you mean a literal week. You were captured by monsters riding monsters, dressed in Victorian era clothes, with both werewolves, vampires. Elves, and Lord knows what else speaking to you. In their near madness of trying to diesect you, began to scream and yell throwing what ever was in reach, eventually getting a sleep spell to your face. In the end a magical necklace was put on your neck, call a 'ueaqilieyA am artifact that allows you to all languages heard, seen, and, translate them back with absolute precision. As it was, your home world somehow made contact with the government here, debated over your being, and, in good faith, came to a decision: that you are now a transfer student in this world, since you can't return home. They sent you a house, some form of electricity, all the essentials, and internet access.

In a week it was built dwarves, you were lectured by elves on etiquettes, and, finally, given a fairly normal house. In another world. With what could be assumed as 'nice' neighbors.

"You are intimidated, sir Jericho?" The elf said as the carriage, began to move.

"Yeah, I mean, yes. It's not just the new environment." You meekly stated looking out into the new city.

"Child, you would do well to remember, that we are not the stories your people weave, we are civilized. Very far from such baseless stories. he stated. "As it is I do recall having such fears once in my younger years. I was half your age when my father took me to a gathering of nobles, we were the only elves in the whole mansion." He once again assumed a very calm demeanor. And silently looked you over.

"Tell me, are humans just as destructive as we claim?" He asked you this time switching your positions.

"I have no idea. There are books about how deprived we can be. Stories of world wars, collapses of entire nations." You paused looking at him eye to eye.

"World wars? What do you mean by world wars?" He asked, this time with a greater interest.

"Ah it was before my time. But there have been two world wars involving most of the nation's and countries of my world." You said a little taken back by his interest in war.

The elf broke your gaze and looked at the glass window. "Ah your destination is upon us Jericho. Let us continue this conversation in a more jovial mood. Do take care in your academics sir."

"Oh, thank you for your company, Venntis." You said. Slowly bowing after you climbed out of the carriage. The elf nodded his head and you turned to leave for class.

"Ah Jericho, one more worthy mention, my daughters Uslia, and Erias attend the academy as well. O have informed them to help you in your endeavors, but no more than that." Venntis said, with a hearty, but barely noticeable grin. You thanked him for watching over you and went to class.
The local, clearly looking at you. Your earthling clothes, headphones, backpack, boots, and, whatever else was on your person.

"Excuse me." You called out to a student, where is alchemy basics? She turned her body around. Only to reveal a fanged, horn, short girl, with blue skin.

"Ah, it's in Mr.Forgear's laboratory, follow this hall to the end and it will be on your left sir." She said, while simply giving you a deep inspection, as were her group of friends......

"Thank you... I'll take my leave now." You said as you went noticing their hushed whispers.

"Oh that's the human?"

"It is cute."

"How brave of it."

"My father told me I must speak to it, to see if we could start trading."

"I heard it is a male."

"Oh it's rather exciting."

You were feeling the heat of the school's new found toy from the locals all ready.

1222.content:
Name: Opal Skyrider
Age: 17
Species: Gargoyle
Grade: 12th
Appearance: Opal is a tall and heavyset gargoyle with blue skin and dark red hair worn in a bob cut with yellow demon-like eyes, blue bat-like wings with red membranes and six stubby horns atop her forehead.
Background: Opal is a gargoyle who has been a student at the academy of Grimoire High for two years, having transferred from a school somewhere in Scotland. Her reason for coming to the school is to seek out a human who made enemies of her gargoyle clan by stealing an enchanted shield that has been in her family for generations. Opal now seeks to recover the shield, having tracked her enemy to Grimoire High where she is planning on finding him and making him pay for his crime.
Any talents or skills: Opal is 50 times stronger than a human being and being a gargoyle, she can fly through use of her large leathery wings. Additionally, she can turn her body into solid rock in order to act as camouflage. She's been studying magic for most of her life and can cast spells by speaking backwards (think of Zatanna).

It is Opal's last year seeking out the shield stealer at Grimoire High and she has yet to find a lead in her quest. At this time, she is growing more and more impatient as she appears to be holding up what appears to be a cybernetic crystal ball. "I am losing patience, Oracle," she says to the crystal. "Two years ago, you told me that the thief would be at Grimoire High and in two years I haven't found any sign of him. "Calm down, Opal. I told you that the thief would be at Grimoire High. That didn't necessarily mean that they would already be there when you arrived." Opal just rolls her eyes. "You oracles take things all too literally."

The oracle sphere just opened up into a crystal eye. The thief has stolen the Viagon Crest and I predict that he will finally be able to tap into the secrets deep within. There are some things that humans weren't meant to know. But I predict that you will meet up with the thief soon. Listen to my instructions...."

That night, Opal paid close attention to what the sphere had to tell her and took note of what she had to do. The next day it was...
1222.title: Opal's Quest

12221.content:
Tomorrow was Monday and Opal was flying to school and finishing her breakfast along the way. She was going to school early because of the oracle crystal's instructions. "I have discovered a way that will force the Viagon Crest to reveal itself, so listen closely, Opal; I have the ability to transform female human beings into monsters, providing they are virgins of course." "Of course," said Opal with a laugh. "What else. So, you want me to start going around turning the entire school into monsters?" "Not quite, my dear Opal. You see, only those with the potential to use magic will be able to transform. Use it on anyone else and they will not survive."

Opal rolled her eyes. "So, don't tell me, you know exactly who will be transformed and can seek them out." "That is correct," said the oracle. "We must seek out nine students of Grimoire High and transmogrify them into our monster allies. My spell will allow them to assume their human forms at will outside of the school in order to limit the drama but we must locate exactly nine." "And where does that get us?" The Oracle Eye then showed an image of a strange rock formation, one that appeared to have nine diagonal shaped rocks that resembled platforms. In the center were rocks that formed the shape of a flower. "When nine virgin monsters arrive at this exact spot, the stone flower will reveal the face of our enemy and the location of the Viagon Crest. But until then, we must create nine polymorph monsters."

Opal nodded her head and arrived at the school where she saw students all around. There were human students among monster girls. One of the monster girls was a female werewolf playing basketball and she waved at Opal as Opal waved back. "Why can't we just gather Luna and eight other monsters, Oracle?" asked Opal to her oracular guide. The Oracle shook his eye. "The spell requires monsters that weren't born monsters."

Opal walks up to the front door and sees two students already near the door. One of which was a female motorcyclist dressed in a delinquent outfit. She had tanned skin and wore her long black hair into a pompadour. The other one was a young British girl who had purple hair and looked very shy and overweight. Suddenly the oracular eye begun to glow and turned around. "What's going on?" asked Opal. "I've found one of our chosen ones." The eye then points to....

122212.content:
The oracular eye pointed to the overweight British girl and Opal noticed it. "Betty Flagg?" asked Opal. "Are you serious?" "I am always serious, Opal," said the oracle eye. "That young woman is the first of our allies." Betty dropped her history book and as she bent over to pick it up, she heard a ripping noise and realized it was her skirt. The overweight girl covered her backside with her book before getting back up. "Oracle," said Opal. "I know Betty. She's an overweight klutz who has tried to get her weight under control but nothing worked." "Perfect," said the oracle. "I know the perfect creature to transform her into."

Betty walked into the school hiding her ripped skirt with her schoolbook. "That's the third skirt this month," she groaned. "I swear I'm going to be immobile by college. Drat." That's when Betty noticed a shadow cast above her and gasped before she turned and saw Opal. The overweight British girl stepped back and accidentally knocked a young man down a small flight of stairs with her large rear before blushing. "Oh," said Betty. "Hi Opal. How's your quest going?" "Not so good," said Opal. "My oracle says that you could be of used to me." Betty let out a scoff. "Me?" she asked. "Don't make me laugh. What am I supposed to do? Suffocate the thief with me big old bum." Opal held up the oracle sphere and it was blinking as it stared at Betty. "Your weight seems to cause you distress."

Betty let out a sigh. "I've been this way since I was born. I tried starving myself and exercise but I just can't shake off this excess fat. I wish I knew a way to become as skinny as a twig." The oracle eye shined bright as Betty looked in surprise. Opal was just as surprised herself. "Opal," said the oracular eye. "Hand me to Betty." Opal did so and Betty held the oracle eye. "From this moment on," said the oracle eye. "You are one of our allies. You'll be a human whenever you choose but you'll leave your humanity behind whenever you are in this school. Now, you shall be the first." The eye glowed and bathed Betty in a strange energy.

Betty screamed as a transformation took place. Even Opal was shocked as Betty's eyes turned bright red and her skin started to fade away. While her purple's hair was in tact, Betty body begun to warp until she had transformed into a seven foot tall skeleton. Betty looked around her bony body and gasped as she even looked at her hands and then looked back at her now bony and thin backside. Opal was horrified. "Oracle!" she yelled. "What did you do? You just killed her!" "Relax, Opal, she isn't really deceased. I have transformed your classmate into a living skeleton. But when outside of Grimoire High, she will be able to return to human form and back at will." Betty just flickered her jawbone and twitched her skeletal fingers.

"This is going to take some getting used to." Suddenly the bell rang. "Geez!" yelled Opal. "We better get to class." With that, the skeleton and gargoyle ran to get to class.

Who's POV do we follow now?

Opal rushed into history class but then grunted because somebody tripped her to the ground. Somebody then stomped her on the tail. “Oops,” said an obnoxious sounding voice. My foot slipped. Opal looked up and bit her lip. “Oh no,” she groaned. “Atlanta.” Opal was looking at a tan-skinned girl who had long yellow-green hair. “Sorry about that, Demona,” said the girl sarcastically. “My eyesight must be going since I didn’t see your fat ass there.” Opal then fell her rather large behind before she growled and made her eyes turn red. “Opal,” said Betty. “Forget about her.” Atlanta looked at Betty in surprise before she let out a last. “Looks like the baby beluga whale finally found a diet that worked. I don’t know what you did, but that’s probably the only way you’ll ever be able to lose weight.” Atlanta continued to laugh as she took her seat at the front of the class.

As Opal walked to her seat she was boiling mad. “Something wrong?” asked the oracular eye. Opal let out a sigh. “It’s Atlanta,” she said. “She’s always making me miserable. She’s one of those humans who believes that monsters should’ve stayed hidden. I heard she’s rich. Her father is a big time CEO.” “Aha,” said the oracle eye as he was twitching. “So she believes that money equals power. How would she like a taste of real power?” Opal gave a look of surprise. “You can’t be serious,” she said. “Atlanta Deneb? One of the nine allies. Get real, Oracle. But then again, it would be interesting to see her as a monster. I’m going to have to put you away now. Mr. Ohsugi is coming.

The teacher came in and from the looks of it, he was a homely and hunchbacked Japanese man. “All eyes on the blackboard,” he said before noticing Betty. “Betty Flag? Is that you?!” Ohsugi saw the now skeletal girl hiding her undead face with her textbook. "This school is getting crazy," said the teacher as he wiped his brow with a handkerchief. "Some of the human students have been hanging with monsters so much that they're becoming monsters themselves." Nervously, Opal tried to put away her oracular eye but she failed to notice that she missed her backpack and the oracle eye rolled underneath Atlanta's chair. He let out a laugh and he looked at Olympia’s panties. “Showtime.” The morally ambiguous eye said.

Mr. Ohsugi was too busy lecturing his geography class to notice the eye preparing to cast a fateful spell and Opal was too busy taking notes to know what was going on. Atlanta was undergoing a transformation, but not the same kind of transformation as Betty. First, her shoes begun to get rather tight. Atlanta grunted. “What is with these shoes?” she thought. “I just bought them yesterday. Atlanta’s feet slipped out of her shoes and revealed that they had turned into golden hooves. At the same time, Atlanta sprouted what looked like gills on her neck as her skin turned a golden yellow orange color from the waist up as her legs expanded into thunderous orange fish-scaled thighs. Atlanta then groaned as her face stretched out to resemble that of a goat and giant curved black horns came out of her head. Finally, she sprouted a giant udder between her legs that tore apart her skirt.

Opal turned her head and spotted her classmate being transformed and gasped. Mr. Ohsugi stopped speaking and gasped at what he saw. Atlanta struggled to get out her desk, only doing so once she broke it. She stood up to learn she was now an 8-foot tall capricorn, a Greek monster resembling a hybrid of a fish and a goat. She looked at her webbed hands and panted before screaming and running out of the room the moment she noticed everyone staring at her. Mr. Ohsugi promptly fainted.

Betty saw what happened and clattered her jaws. “Suddenly,” she said. “Being turned into a skeleton doesn’t seem so bad.” The oracular eye rolled its way back to Opal who gave a look of horror before making her eyes glow red with anger as she looked at the eye. “Only, lucky seven to go.” Was all the oracle had to say for his actions.

Who’s POV do we follow now?
1222121.title: Get My Goat

choices: Opal's as she Enters the Next Class
Sara's as She Shows Her New Power to Her Boss
12221211.content:
Opal stomped out of class rather angrily at the oracle eye. “I can’t believe you turned Atlanta into a capricorn, Oracle,” she said. “I am going to tell grandfather how malignant you are. Why he assigned a trickster like you to advise me on my mission, I’ll never know.” “I am an oracle,” said the eye. “You’re not supposed to like me.” “You are going to get us both in big trouble if you keep turning my classmates into monsters.” “I told you, only nine people in this school are your chosen allies and only I can seek them out.” Opal’s eyes glowed bright and then the gargoyle twitched because somebody had pulled on her tail. Opal turned her head and then gasped because she spotted somebody who wasn’t a student but one of the teachers. She was a tall and pear-shaped redhead with gray eyes and a smirk on her face. She was wearing a tan yellow business suit and a pair of glasses. “Hello, Opal.” She said with an evil tone in her voice.

Opal begun to shiver and the gargoyle even curled up her wings. “Vie Principal Hall,” she said. “I can explain.” However, the vice principal begun to circle around the gargoyle girl. “Oh,” she said. “No need to explain. I saw what you did to Betty and I’m impressed. You’ve found a way to convert weak humans into all powerful monsters.” The vice principal cackled and shook her hips as the oracle eye followed her every move. “I am really sorry,” said Opal. “Please don’t expel me, Vice…” “Please, call me Sara. And I’m not going to punish you, so long as you do me a favor.” Opal didn’t like the sound of that. “What kind of favor?” the gargoyle asked nervously.

Vice Principal Hall took off her glasses and smiled. “Turn me into a monster too.” Opal was confused. “Say what?!” she yelled. “You actually want to be a monster?” “I don’t care what kind,” said Sara with a smirk. “Make me a big fat minotaur or even a three headed hellhound. I don’t care! Just make me a big and powerful monster. I’m sick of being a weak human being.” The oracle eye lit up. “She’s one of them.” “Oracle,” said Opal. “I don’t think that’s such a good idea. I don’t like the implications of whatever she has in mind once she’s a monster.” But Sara just snatched the eye and gave a smirk. “It was this eye that transmogrified those girls. Alright, oracle, work your magic.” The oracle let out a giggle as Sara shoved him into her breasts. “Enough with the ogling! Make me fierce!” The oracle obliged and bathed the vice principal in a strange magical energy.

Sara moaned in ecstasy as she was being transformed, almost as if she was sexually aroused. First, she grew fangs and her ears and hips expanded. Sara looked back at her ass as dark grayish brown tail feathers sprouted. “Yes,” she said. “Yes.” Sara then saw her feet turn into a pair of large silver talons with toenails as sharp as knives. The vice principal smiled wickedly as she held out her arms which sprouted grayish brown and white feathers and a color of white feathers appeared around her neck as her breasts expanded. Her large size and wings made her resemble a condor.

The oracle eye slipped out of Sara’s cleavage as the transformation was complete and the vice principal stood as a 10 foot tall harpy. “A harpy?” she asked giddily. “Perfect.” With that, Sara flapped her wings and let out a laugh as she flew down the hallway. Opal gulped. “I hope you did the right thing, Oracle.” The oracle let out a scoff. “At least we have three down. Now, let’s find the next ally.

Who’s POV do we follow now?
12221211.title: Give Her the Bird

choices: Continue with Opal in Gym Class
Continue with Selena at Archery Practice
122212111.content:
Opal's next class was math class and as she sat down in her seat, another student sat next to her. She was a Native American teenage girl who was wearing sports tape around her wrists and a duffle bag that had a bow in it as well as her school books. The girl noticed Opal and then smiled. "Hi, Opal. How goes the quest?" Opal let out a sigh. "It's going as well as it can Selena." Selena Mustang was Opal's closest friend and she was the captain of the archery team at school. She was the one who was most open to the idea of monsters attending Grimoire High and she and her gargoyle friend were on very good terms.

Then Selena smirked at Opal. "What's that I hear about human girls turning into monsters, Opal?" she asked cheekily. "First the chubby and timid Betty gets turned into a living skeleton and then that snob Atlanta becomes a capricorn and now I hear that the vice principal turned into a harpy. Then again, she already was a harpy in the metaphorical sense. It did cross my mind that your oracle friend has been busy." Opal let out a sigh. “Well. The oracle told me that I was to find 9 virgins and they would help me from the enemy that I’m looking for.” Selena let out a laugh. “Well, you have 6 to go.” Maybe I’m on the list.” Opal and Selena laughed to themselves but then stopped because the mean and nasty math teacher, Mr. Maddocks walked in. “Alright, Neanderthals. Open your books to page 32.” Mr. Maddocks stared at Opal. “And in case you freaks don’t know how to count, it’s the page with this symbol at the bottom.” Mr. Maddocks drew the number 32 on the blackboard. Opal gave a scoff. “Jerk.” She said.

As the math teacher was droning on, the oracle ball slipped into Selena's duffle bag and then took a good long look at Selena. "Hmm," he said. "Very interesting. She's 1 of the 9. Not that I'm surprised. Aha." The Oracle emitted magic energy that enveloped Selena as she was busy taking notes. First, her legs took on a cream and cinnamon fur color and then her butt begun to expand and elongate until her pants and underwear were completely destroyed and she sprouted a long tail the same color as her midnight colored hair. She also grew a second pair of legs that ended in hooves. Her front feet also transformed into hooves as they slipped out of her shoes. Finally, Selena's ears turned into those of a Przewalski's Horse. She had become a centaur.

However, since Selena was sitting down in a chair at the time, the transformation was very uncomfortable and she was grunting in absolute pain as she shook her rear. This disturbed the math teacher who glared at her. “For ****’s sake, Ms. Mustang, what is wrong with you!” Mr. Maddocks then screamed because Selena stood up and she was wearing her chair around her horse back between her front and back legs. She grunted slightly and broke the chair off as the rest of the class gasped. Opal’s jaw dropped and then she angrily picked up the oracle and put him back in her own backpack. Selena then glared at Opal who could only smile sheepishly.

Once class was over, Selena gave Opal an earful. “You know. I was being sarcastic. And yet your stupid orb turns me into a centaur.” “Don’t get overheated, Selena,” said Opal. “The oracle said that you’ll be a monster every second you’re on school property but outside of the school you can transform between human and monster of your own free will.” Selena then felt a fly on her horse rump and spanked herself with her tail to swat it. “Well,” said Selena. “From the looks of it, I’ll have no choice but to take all my classes standing up from now on, pants will be out of the question and my parents are going to have to convert my bedroom into a stable. It’s lucky for you that I have archery practice at the same time you have gym. I’ll talk to you about this later.”

Opal nodded her head and let out a sigh as she watched her friend galloping away. Selena then paused. “Hmm,” she said. “On second thought, I could really work out with twice the legs. Perhaps I’ll let Opal off easy.” As Opal walked down the hall, she passed a natural-born centaur girl who stared at her horse half and scoffed. “Definitely implants.”

1223.content:
How about we try a couple of monsters from the land of the rising sun?

Yokai #1

Name: Lynda Matsuyama

Species: Kappa

Age: 72

Appearance: A 10’ foot tall 6 ton yokai resembling a rotund anthropomorphic female sea turtle with lavender skin with purple spots and a bright blue shell. She has reddish brown hair worn in a Japanese style bun and a beaked face with a light blue birthmark on the tip of her upper lip. Being an aquatic monster, she has webbed hands and feet and being a kappa, she has a large dome in the center of her head that is filled with water. Due to her shell she is unable to wear clothing. In spire of her age, Lynda looks 29 due to kappas having a very, very long lifespan.

Job: Coach

Background: Lynda is a yokai from Japan who who used to live in an underground grotto until she was forced to surface due to an earthquake. For decades she was the reigning champion in yokai sumo before monsters and humans integrated their society with one another and Lynda found herself fighting yokai and humans, the latter of which could never prove a challenge for her. Growing tired of a wrestling ring where she ruled undefeated, Lynda moved from Japan and got a job as a wrestling coach at the monster girls academy. However, she hasn’t lost her edge and likes to remind a few troublemaking students that picking a fight with her is a seriously bad idea. The students, male and female, monster and human are intimidated by the very large kappa woman but she has a softer side that is brought out when she is with her adoptive human son.

Talents and Skills: Being a kappa, Lynda can swim as fast as a torpedo, stay underwater for hours without coming up for air, and is skilled in sumo wrestling. Lynda’s shell is indestructible enough to withstand an explosion and she is strong enough to lift a truck with one arm. In spite of her massive bulk, Lynda is as graceful as a ballerina.Tengu

Yokai # 2

Name: Kasumi Yoda

Species: Tengu

Age: 26

Appearance: A rather fat and bright red-skinned goblin woman with large black-feathered wings on her back. Being a tengu, Kasumi has a very long nose. She also has platinum blonde hair and blue patch over her left eye. For clothing, she usually wears a pair of white jeans with a green jacket, black tanktop and a pair of tengu geta sandals.

Job: Security Guard

Background: Kasumi is a Japanese immigrant to the who was forced to leave Japan and get a job at the monster girl academy. She was the witness to a terrible crime and her testimony revealed that a particularly dangerous yokai was responsible and resulted in that very same yokai being imprisoned, bringing a grudge that threatened the young tengu woman’s life. Kasumi had no choice but to live among humans. Unfortunately, Kasumi like most tengus, doesn’t like humans that much and likes to play tricks on them whenever she gets the chance. Some of her tricks are harmless but other times they can be dangerous. However, she saves her more fiendish tricks for troublesome boys.

Talents and Skills: Kasumi is very clever and skilled with medicines, potions and spells. Being an air element monster, she can move at rapid speed and fly really high. She also possesses the ability to perform certain ninjutsu techniques such as teleportation and substitution. Kasumi’s nails are sharp enough to cut the air and create razor winds that can cut through steel. Finally, Kasumi possesses an invisibility cloak that allows her to hide from humans.

Now who do we follow?
